text: (upbeat music)
- We are a global manufacturing company
that makes aerial work platforms
and material processing machinery.
We started with really looking
at our manufacturing processes

and how we could go into
lean and digital together.

We started with custom
developed applications.
We transitioned very quickly

by taking input from our
manufacturing engineers

to a low-code, no-code
platform called Tulip
that's hosted on AWS.

All of our factories have
manufacturing engineers

that develop applications
locally for their own factory.
That data goes in into our data lake

that we have for our
entire global ecosystem,
so we're able to marry that data up,
regardless of where it comes from,
into all of the operational KPIs
that our leaders need to see.
From a customer perspective,

it's giving us the ability
to see the machines
as they're being created,

and it's also giving us the
ability to pull the data in
from the machines in the field.
We're able to analyze that data

and really see how the
behavior in the field is

versus the process that
we use to manufacture.
